2023-02-01.name: Winter Carnival
2023-02-01.summary: This outdoor festival around Rice Park downtown features ice carving, parades, scavenger hunts, pop-up outdoor concerts, ice-fishing and softball and puzzle tournaments.

2023-02-01.name: Restaurant Week
2023-02-01.summary: Time to pack on the calories: More than 370 restaurants offer three-course prix-fixe menus for $25 at brunch or lunch and $42 or $59 at dinner.

2023-02-01.name: Groundhog Days
2023-02-01.summary: The 1993 movie "Groundhog Day'' was filmed in this town an hour northwest of Chicago, and it celebrates with trivia, a bags tourney, bingo and walking tours of movie sites, including the 1889 Opera House, where actor Bill Murray jumped from the belfry. At 7 a.m. Thursday, Woodstock Willie will look for his shadow.

2023-02-01.name: Winterfest and U.S. Snow Sculpting Championship
2023-02-01.summary: In this lake town, there's music, magic shows, a human sled-dog race, a cocoa crawl, ice bars and an ice castle, plus the U.S. snow-sculpting championship.

2023-02-02.name: Winter Carnival
2023-02-02.summary: This outdoor festival around Rice Park downtown features ice carving, parades, scavenger hunts, pop-up outdoor concerts, ice-fishing and softball and puzzle tournaments.

2023-02-02.name: Restaurant Week
2023-02-02.summary: Time to pack on the calories: More than 370 restaurants offer three-course prix-fixe menus for $25 at brunch or lunch and $42 or $59 at dinner.

2023-02-02.summary: The 1993 movie "Groundhog Day'' was filmed in this town an hour northwest of Chicago, and it celebrates with trivia, a bags tourney, bingo and walking tours of movie sites, including the 1889 Opera House, where actor Bill Murray jumped from the belfry. At 7 a.m. Thursday, Woodstock Willie will look for his shadow.

2023-02-02.name: Winterfest and U.S. Snow Sculpting Championship
2023-02-02.summary: In this lake town, there's music, magic shows, a human sled-dog race, a cocoa crawl, ice bars and an ice castle, plus the U.S. snow-sculpting championship.

2023-02-02.name: Winter Festival
2023-02-02.summary: There's a snow sculpting contest, an arts walk, music, beard and mustache championships and snowshoe tours to Sigurd Olson's Listening Point.

2023-02-02.name: Winter Dance Party
2023-02-02.summary: The Surf Ballroom marks the 64th anniversary of the plane crash that killed Buddy Holly, with concerts, luncheons, dance lessons and crash-site tours.

2023-02-03.name: Winter Carnival
2023-02-03.summary: This outdoor festival around Rice Park downtown features ice carving, parades, scavenger hunts, pop-up outdoor concerts, ice-fishing and softball and puzzle tournaments.

2023-02-03.name: Restaurant Week
2023-02-03.summary: Time to pack on the calories: More than 370 restaurants offer three-course prix-fixe menus for $25 at brunch or lunch and $42 or $59 at dinner.

2023-02-03.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2023-02-03.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2023-02-03.name: Lake Minnetonka Klondike Dog Derby
2023-02-03.summary: On Friday, spectators can meet the mushers and dogs and go on sled-dog rides. The races begin at 10 a.m. Saturday, and there will also be bonfires, games and beverages at the Klondike Village.

2023-02-03.name: Snowflake Ski-Jumping Tournament
2023-02-03.summary: It's the 100th year for this tournament. At the top of a hill that's the equivalent of a 41-story skyscraper, watch jumpers fly by at 55 mph. It's fun to watch because the jump is built onto the side of a coulee, and spectators can climb it and watch from the top. There are hot drinks and food at the bottom.

2023-02-03.name: Groundhog Days
2023-02-03.summary: The 1993 movie "Groundhog Day'' was filmed in this town an hour northwest of Chicago, and it celebrates with trivia, a bags tourney, bingo and walking tours of movie sites, including the 1889 Opera House, where actor Bill Murray jumped from the belfry. At 7 a.m. Thursday, Woodstock Willie will look for his shadow.

2023-02-03.name: Winterfest and U.S. Snow Sculpting Championship
2023-02-03.summary: In this lake town, there's music, magic shows, a human sled-dog race, a cocoa crawl, ice bars and an ice castle, plus the U.S. snow-sculpting championship.

2023-02-03.name: Winter Festival
2023-02-03.summary: There's a snow sculpting contest, an arts walk, music, beard and mustache championships and snowshoe tours to Sigurd Olson's Listening Point.

2023-02-03.name: Winter Dance Party
2023-02-03.summary: The Surf Ballroom marks the 64th anniversary of the plane crash that killed Buddy Holly, with concerts, luncheons, dance lessons and crash-site tours.

2023-02-03.name: Hot Air Affair
2023-02-03.summary: There will be balloon rides, moon glows and such events as geocaching, bird-watching, a fat-tire bike race and a corn-hole tournament.

2023-02-03.name: Ice Breaker
2023-02-03.summary: There's an ice-carving competition in this Lake Michigan town, plus a chili cook-off. curling lessons, frozen-fish fling, cardboard-sled race and pub slide.

2023-02-03.name: Magical Ice Fest
2023-02-03.summary: Watch the pros carve sculptures in this Lake Michigan town. There's also entertainment, a scavenger hunt and magic and crafts for kids.

2023-02-03.name: Knickerbocker Ice Festival
2023-02-03.summary: The festival in this town east of Madison includes such events as a fish toss, snowball-eating contest, dad-sled race, chili cook-off and Iceberg Open golf tournament. There's ice carving and ice wine, too.

2023-02-03.name: Banbury Art Crawl
2023-02-03.summary: Visit more than 100 artists at studios in the Building 13 art complex. Many will give demonstrations. There will be also music, food and art projects for children.

2023-02-03.name: Winter Festival
2023-02-03.summary: This Door County village lets loose with such events as a  toilet-seat throw, pie tin toss, bean-bag cannon shoot, smoosh racing and an  ugly-sweater contest. There are also free trolley rides, ice carving, a fiddle contest, a snowshoe dance and  fireworks.

2023-02-03.name: Heikki Lunta Winter Festival
2023-02-03.summary: This town just west of Marquette pays tribute to the Finnish snow god with a rail jam, snowshoe lantern tours, sliding, luging, a fat-tire race and fireworks.

2023-02-04.name: Winter Carnival
2023-02-04.summary: This outdoor festival around Rice Park downtown features ice carving, parades, scavenger hunts, pop-up outdoor concerts, ice-fishing and softball and puzzle tournaments.

2023-02-04.name: Duluth Ice & Mixed Fest
2023-02-04.summary: This annual festival in West Duluth's Quarry Park features such events as a free ice-climbing clinic for youths 12 and older, beginner and intermediate clinics for adult climbers, a fat-bike intro and presentations on mountain climbing.

2023-02-04.name: WinterFest
2023-02-04.summary: In this Brainerd Lakes area town, there are horse-drawn sleigh rides, bonfires, soup sampling, ice car races, Friday fireworks and Italian Outdoor Olympics.

2023-02-04.summary: There will be balloon rides, moon glows and such events as geocaching, bird-watching, a fat-tire bike race and a corn-hole tournament.

2023-02-04.summary: For recreational skiers, the highlight of this big cross-country ski festival is the Saturday-night Luminary Loppet on Lake of the Isles, with glowing ice pillars and "ruins.'' Reserve a time slot in advance.

2023-02-04.name: Hygge Festival
2023-02-04.summary: This northwoods festival, named for the Scandinavian concept of winter coziness, features a tour of great fireplaces, romantic sleigh rides, guided waterfall hikes and live music.

2023-02-05.summary: This festival shows a large selection of documentaries specializing in adventure, extreme sports and environmental issues.

2023-02-10.name: Winter Carnival
2023-02-10.summary: This snow fest at Michigan Tech University includes a human dog-sled race, snow volleyball and a tug of war and ends with a torchlight parade and fireworks at Mont Ripley ski hill.

2023-02-10.name: Michigan Ice Fest
2023-02-10.summary: Watch ice-climbing demos, slide shows and professional climbers and take clinics for beginners at spectacular Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore on Lake Superior.

2023-02-10.name: Polar Fest
2023-02-10.summary: This festival features such events as ice golf, a Freeze Your Buns run, a snowshoe hike in Tamarac Wildlife Refuge and kite-flying, with professional giant-kite flyers, kite decorating and prizes for amateurs.

2023-02-10.name: Sturgeon Spectacular
2023-02-10.summary: Lake Winnebago is the setting for this celebration of giant fish. There will be ice carving and snow sculpting, a snowman-building contest, bonfires and live music.

2023-02-10.name: Scandihoovian Winter Festival
2023-02-10.summary: The festival in this town just west of Madison features such events as turkey bowling, a snowman-building contest, kick sledding, a spelling bee and a vintage snowmobile show and ride.

2023-02-10.name: Celebration of the Lakes
2023-02-10.summary: This festival north of the Twin Cities includes snowmobile races, fat biking, an ice-fishing tournament, sled-dog rides and a free ice-fishing clinic for kids.

2023-02-10.name: Winter Carnival
2023-02-10.summary: The Wisconsin Union sponsors a week of fun on Lake Mendota: skating, skiing, snowshoeing, snowboarding, mini-golf and kiting, plus music and the return of Lady Liberty on Friday.

2023-02-11.name: Kites on Ice Festival
2023-02-11.summary: This festival on Buffalo Lake and in Sturges Park, just northwest of Minneapolis, features show-kite flyers, free kites for kids, a beer garden, dog-sled rides and a cornhole tournament.

2023-02-11.name: Ice Lantern Festival
2023-02-11.summary: See ice lanterns created by artists and students in this arty southwest Wisconsin town and visit the cupcake/cookie/hot chocolate bar as well as the ice bar.

2023-02-11.name: Free Snowmobiling Weekend
2023-02-11.summary: This weekend, snowmobilers don't need a registration or trail permit to use thousands of miles of trails in the Upper Peninsula or in Lower Michigan.

2023-02-11.name: Hygge Festival
2023-02-11.summary: This northwoods festival, named for the Scandinavian concept of winter coziness, features a tour of great fireplaces, romantic sleigh rides, guided waterfall hikes and live music.

2023-02-24.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2023-02-24.name: Polar Fest
2023-02-24.summary: This festival features such events as ice golf, a Freeze Your Buns run, a snowshoe hike in Tamarac Wildlife Refuge and kite-flying, with professional giant-kite flyers, kite decorating and prizes for amateurs.

2023-02-24.name: American Birkebeiner
2023-02-24.summary: The "Greatest Show on Snow'' includes races of all distances for all ages and abilities plus skijoring and vintage ski.

2023-02-24.name: SocialICE
2023-02-24.summary: At Peace Plaza downtown, five ice bars each offer a different theme and signature drink, with ice sculptures illuminated by lights and nightly DJ entertainment. On Saturday afternoon, there's a FAM JAM for families.

2023-02-25.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2023-02-25.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2023-02-25.name: Polar Fest
2023-02-25.summary: This festival features such events as ice golf, a Freeze Your Buns run, a snowshoe hike in Tamarac Wildlife Refuge and kite-flying, with professional giant-kite flyers, kite decorating and prizes for amateurs.

2023-02-25.name: American Birkebeiner
2023-02-25.summary: The "Greatest Show on Snow'' includes races of all distances for all ages and abilities plus skijoring and vintage ski.

2023-02-25.name: Grumpy Old Men Festival
2023-02-25.summary: There's always good eagle-viewing in this Mississippi River town, and during the festival, there will be an ice-fishing contest, polar plunge and minnow races.

2023-02-25.name: SocialICE
2023-02-25.summary: At Peace Plaza downtown, five ice bars each offer a different theme and signature drink, with ice sculptures illuminated by lights and nightly DJ entertainment. On Saturday afternoon, there's a FAM JAM for families.

2023-02-25.name: Bald Eagle Appreciation Days
2023-02-25.summary: Birding experts give live-eagle and raptor programs, and volunteers man spotting scopes at overlooks. There will also be children's activities and a life-size eagle nest.

2023-02-25.name: Bockfest at Capital Brewery
2023-02-25.summary: This Madison-area brewery celebrates with the Running of the Blondes 1K race, a fish toss, music, costumes and, of course, beer. Tickets go on sale Dec. 1 and sell out fast.

2023-02-25.name: Trenary Outhouse Classic
2023-02-25.summary: In this little town, not far from Munising and Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore, there will be potty-pushing contests for kids and adults, a best fur-hat contest and lots of craft beer.

2023-02-25.name: Chili Ice Walk
2023-02-25.summary: Between noon and 4 p.m., walk downtown to see ice sculpting, sample chili from eight restaurants and go on a scavenger hunt in shop windows.

2023-02-17.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2023-02-17.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2023-02-17.name: Polar Fest
2023-02-17.summary: This festival features such events as ice golf, a Freeze Your Buns run, a snowshoe hike in Tamarac Wildlife Refuge and kite-flying, with professional giant-kite flyers, kite decorating and prizes for amateurs.

2023-02-17.name: Winterfest
2023-02-17.summary: In this St. Croix River town, there will be a parka pub crawl, ice maze, stein-holding and beard contests, axe-throwing, ice carving and Saturday parade and fireworks.

2023-02-17.name: Fire & Ice
2023-02-17.summary: Ice and snow sculptors create pieces around town. There's a novice category for beginners. On Friday, there will be a candlelight ski/hike at Big Creek Nature Preserve, and on Saturday, there will be fireworks.

2023-02-17.name: Big Turn Music Fest
2023-02-17.summary: More than 200 bands play at more than 20 venues around Red Wing.

2023-02-17.name: Winter Jubilee
2023-02-17.summary: This Brainerd Lakes town celebrates with smoosh racing, competitions in snow sculpting, nail driving, ice fishing and wood splitting, and a Saturday parade.

2023-02-18.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2023-02-18.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2023-02-18.name: Polar Fest
2023-02-18.summary: This festival features such events as ice golf, a Freeze Your Buns run, a snowshoe hike in Tamarac Wildlife Refuge and kite-flying, with professional giant-kite flyers, kite decorating and prizes for amateurs.

2023-02-18.name: Winterfest
2023-02-18.summary: In this St. Croix River town, there will be a parka pub crawl, ice maze, stein-holding and beard contests, axe-throwing, ice carving and Saturday parade and fireworks.

2023-02-18.name: Fire & Ice
2023-02-18.summary: Ice and snow sculptors create pieces around town. There's a novice category for beginners. On Friday, there will be a candlelight ski/hike at Big Creek Nature Preserve, and on Saturday, there will be fireworks.

2023-02-18.name: Big Turn Music Fest
2023-02-18.summary: More than 200 bands play at more than 20 venues around Red Wing.

2023-02-18.name: Winter Festival
2023-02-18.summary: This festival just north of Milwaukee features barrel and bed races, ice-carving, camel rides, a dog weight  pull competition, an egg hunt for kids and a parade at 1 p.m. Saturday.

2023-02-18.name: Free Weekend in Michigan state parks
2023-02-18.summary: There's no vehicle-entry fee in Michigan state parks this weekend, and Saturday and Sunday also is Free Fishing Weekend.

2023-02-18.name: Book Across the Bay
2023-02-18.summary: Ski or snowshoe across Lake Superior's Chequamegon Bay on a 10-kilometer loop lined by ice luminaries, snow sculptures and bonfires. Back in Ashland, there's a chili feed and music.

2023-02-18.name: Color the Wind Kite Festival
2023-02-18.summary: This town in north-central Iowa draws kiters from eight states for its festival, the largest in the Midwest, and stunt fliers will perform routines choreographed to music.

2023-02-18.name: Barstool Races
2023-02-18.summary: In this small town north of Cable, watch people careen down a hill on decorated bar stools, then stay for the chili feed.

2023-02-18.name: Northwoods Blizzard Blast
2023-02-18.summary: On the snowy northeast edge of Wisconsin, go on horse-drawn sleigh rides and see such events as recliner racing, ice bowling, dog-sled dashing, snowshoe baseball and snow sculpting.

2023-02-18.name: Winter Jubilee
2023-02-18.summary: This Brainerd Lakes town celebrates with smoosh racing, competitions in snow sculpting, nail driving, ice fishing and wood splitting, and a Saturday parade.

2023-02-18.name: Free Entrance Day at Minnesota state parks
2023-02-18.summary: Entrance to all 75 Minnesota state parks and recreation areas is free today.

2023-02-12.name: Art Shanty Projects
2023-02-12.summary: Frozen Lake Harriet hosts two dozen artist-designed ice houses and lots of fun art antics for kids and adults alike. Check for scheduled events and ice conditions.

2023-02-12.name: Winter Festival
2023-02-12.summary: There's a snow sculpting contest, an arts walk, music, beard and mustache championships and snowshoe tours to Sigurd Olson's Listening Point.

2023-02-12.name: Frozen River Film Festival
2023-02-12.summary: This festival shows a large selection of documentaries specializing in adventure, extreme sports and environmental issues.

2023-02-12.name: Michigan Ice Fest
2023-02-12.summary: Watch ice-climbing demos, slide shows and professional climbers and take clinics for beginners at spectacular Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore on Lake Superior.

2023-02-12.name: Polar Fest
2023-02-12.summary: This festival features such events as ice golf, a Freeze Your Buns run, a snowshoe hike in Tamarac Wildlife Refuge and kite-flying, with professional giant-kite flyers, kite decorating and prizes for amateurs.

2023-02-12.name: Sturgeon Spectacular
2023-02-12.summary: Lake Winnebago is the setting for this celebration of giant fish. There will be ice carving and snow sculpting, a snowman-building contest, bonfires and live music.

2023-02-12.name: Scandihoovian Winter Festival
2023-02-12.summary: The festival in this town just west of Madison features such events as turkey bowling, a snowman-building contest, kick sledding, a spelling bee and a vintage snowmobile show and ride.

2023-02-12.name: Celebration of the Lakes
2023-02-12.summary: This festival north of the Twin Cities includes snowmobile races, fat biking, an ice-fishing tournament, sled-dog rides and a free ice-fishing clinic for kids.

2023-02-12.name: Free Snowmobiling Weekend
2023-02-12.summary: This weekend, snowmobilers don't need a registration or trail permit to use thousands of miles of trails in the Upper Peninsula or in Lower Michigan.

2023-02-12.name: Hygge Festival
2023-02-12.summary: This northwoods festival, named for the Scandinavian concept of winter coziness, features a tour of great fireplaces, romantic sleigh rides, guided waterfall hikes and live music.

2023-02-06.name: Winter Carnival
2023-02-06.summary: The Wisconsin Union sponsors a week of fun on Lake Mendota: skating, skiing, snowshoeing, snowboarding, mini-golf and kiting, plus music and the return of Lady Liberty on Friday.

2023-02-19.name: Winter Festival
2023-02-19.summary: This festival just north of Milwaukee features barrel and bed races, ice-carving, camel rides, a dog weight  pull competition, an egg hunt for kids and a parade at 1 p.m. Saturday.

2023-02-19.name: Free Weekend in Michigan state parks
2023-02-19.summary: There's no vehicle-entry fee in Michigan state parks this weekend, and Saturday and Sunday also is Free Fishing Weekend.

2023-02-19.name: Winter Jubilee
2023-02-19.summary: This Brainerd Lakes town celebrates with smoosh racing, competitions in snow sculpting, nail driving, ice fishing and wood splitting, and a Saturday parade.
